content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

In Julia, you can write a function to clean column names as follows:

```julia
function clean_column(col::AbstractString)
    # Lowercase the string
    lc_col = lowercase(col)
    
    # Strip leading and trailing whitespace
    trimmed_col = strip(lc_col)
    
    # Replace spaces and hyphens with underscore
    cleaned_col = replace(trimmed_col, r"\s|-" => "_")
    
    return cleaned_col
end
```

This function `clean_column` takes a string `col` as input, and returns the cleaned version of the column name. It first lowercases the string, then strips any leading or trailing whitespace, and finally replaces spaces and hyphens with an underscore.

You can call this function on a specific column name like so:

```julia
julia> clean_column("My Column")
"my_column"
```

This will return the cleaned column name "my_column".
